intro: Renealmia exaltata var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender renealmia, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family, which includes many ornamental plants known for their striking foliage. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces clusters of small, white flowers that appear in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and can exhibit a range of colors, from green to reddish hues. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for tropical gardens.
